article.headline: Portland St. 76, Cal St.-Fullerton 75
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. -- Jamie Jones connected on a short jump hook with 10 seconds to play to lift Portland State to a 76-75 win over Cal State Fullerton on Sunday. Fullerton had to a chance to win at the buzzer, but Gerard Anderson's heavily contested jumper fell short. Jones led Portland State (3-0) with 21 points. Andre Murray added 16 for the Vikings, who have won 12 straight home games. Josh Akognon paced Fullerton (2-2) with 20 points on 8-of-23 shooting. Anderson had 18 points and 10 rebounds for the Titans and Aaron Thompson chipped in with 13 points. Portland State battled back from an 11-point deficit midway through the second half, tying the score at 66 when Tyrell Mara connected on a 3-pointer with 4:47 left. The Vikings took their first lead of the half when Kyle Coston hit a 3-pointer that gave them a 71-68 lead with 2:57 remaining. The teams exchanged leads down the stretch until Jones hit the game-winner. Both teams shot 40 percent. Fullerton outrebounded the Vikings 47-34 and shot 86 percent from the free-throw line. But the Titans tossed away those advantages by committing 25 turnovers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
